repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Enterprise and Financial Sector
            Adjustment Credit Project and Technical Assistance Project
            for Economic Reform

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcomes of both projects are rated
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned are: a) It is
            essential to effective program implementation that there be
            sustained Government commitment and IDA(International
            Development Association) and Government staff continuity. b)
            Although the objectives of both operations were clear and
            remain relevant today, more realism should be built into the
            timetables. c) Ultimate operational objectives should be
            defined by clear interim steps so that the Government can
            readily assess whether it is on track for meeting its
            objectives or not. d) Intense supervision is required for
            technical support, particularly for a low income country
            with little IDA and other donor experience. e) Although the
            Government was committed to implementing the programs agreed
            under the Enterprise and Financial Sector Adjustment Credit,
            the constant support and guidance of IDA was requested and
            needed to maintain the momentum in implementing agreed
            programs and to adhere to difficult decisions. f)
            Albania's difficulty in creating a modern banking
            system is not dissimilar to that of other formerly socialist
            economies. Technical assistance is not sufficient to change
            bank operations rapidly. g) The built-in flexibility of the
            technical project was a crucial factor in the successful
            outcome of this operation.

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Enterprise and Financial Sector
            Adjustment Credit

abstracts.cdata!:
The Enterprise and Financial Sector
            Adjustment Credit will support the development of a banking
            system, continued privatization in the industrial sector and
            decisive downsizing or liquidation of inviable state enterprises.
